description:
Manages a Load Balancer Outbound Rule.

~> **NOTE** When using this resource, the Load Balancer needs to have a FrontEnd IP Configuration and a Backend Address Pool Attached.

Name.description: The name of the Frontend IP Configuration.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

AllocatedOutboundPorts.description: The number of outbound ports to be used for NAT.

BackendAddressPoolId.description: The ID of the Backend Address Pool. Outbound traffic is randomly load balanced across IPs in the backend IPs.

EnableTcpReset.description: Receive bidirectional TCP Reset on TCP flow idle timeout or unexpected connection termination. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

IdleTimeoutInMinutes.description: The timeout for the TCP idle connection.

LoadbalancerId.description: The ID of the Load Balancer in which to create the Outbound Rule. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Name.description: Specifies the name of the Outbound Rule. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Protocol.description: The transport protocol for the external endpoint. Possible values are `Udp`, `Tcp` or `All`.

ResourceGroupName.description: The name of the resource group in which to create the resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
